remarks: This is the first of a number of theorems which allow sets to be proven Diophantine by syntactic induction, and models the correspondence between Diophantine sets and monotone existential first-order logic. This first theorem shows that the zero set of an implicit polynomial is Diophantine.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 10-Oct-2014.)
statement:
eq0rabdioph $p |- ( ( N e. NN0 /\ ( t e. ( ZZ ^m ( 1 ... N ) ) |-> A ) e. ( mzPoly ` ( 1 ... N ) ) ) -> { t e. ( NN0 ^m ( 1 ... N ) ) | A = 0 } e. ( Dioph ` N ) ) $.
$d N t $.
